results.title: Dr. Strangelove or How I learned to stop worrying and love the bomb [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Stanley Kubrick, Victor Lyndon and Columbia
results.brief_description: A crazy General, Jack D. Ripper, obsessed by the fear that the Communists are controlling the fluoridation of the U.S. water supply, unleashes his wing of H-bombers against Russia. The President of the United States, his Chiefs of Staff at the Pentagon and even the sinister Dr. Strangelove, realise it is too late to call off the attack so they await the awesome consequences. This controversial black comedy stars Peter Sellers in three separate roles; other stars include George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden and Slim Pickens. In turn hilarious, satirical and even terrifying, Dr. Strangelove is a guide on How To Stop Worrying and Love The Bomb.

results.title: Dr. No (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr.No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist plots to overtake the world but is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her first screen appearance in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme and elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder have become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: Dr. No
results.brief_description: In 1962, audiences were introduced to the suave super spy James Bond in the first instalment of the classic franchise, <.i>Dr. No. Bond, James Bond has since shot up the screen 25 times and become a pop-culture icon.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

results.description: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.
description_for_label: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.

results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: Dr. Elizabeth Kubler Ross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr Elizabeth Kubler-Ross explains her treatment of the problems surrounding death and dying. She also details ways of dealing with the particular problems involved in coming to terms with the death of a young child

results.title: Dr Terror's house of horror
results.creator_credit: Freddy Frances, Paul Stone and Amicus Productions
results.brief_description: During the 1960s and 70s, Amicus Productions were one of the most popular horror movie-making studios. “Dr Terror’s house of horror” was the first Amicus film, and with its portmanteau structure, features an array of supernatural settings. In a railway carriage sit five men; a mysterious doctor joins them and offers to tell their terrible fortunes. In them, a werewolf menaces a realtor; an art critic is terrorised by the severed hand of a disgruntled artist; a third man suspects his wife is a vampire; a jazz musician is pursued by a voodoo curse; a cottage is besieged by a monster vine. With its frightening narratives, and great cast, this is a wonderfully creepy classic horror experience. Also known as “Blood suckers”.

results.title: Dr Spock
results.brief_description: Presents the theories and practice of Dr. Benjamin Spock and his suggestions to parents for dealing with the problems, foibles and characteristics of children from infancy to the age of six.
